channel.title: food on Tolar Town
channel.description: Recent content in food on Tolar Town

item.title: Shandong Mama Mini, NGV, Ian Potter, Eau de Vie, Black Pearl, Capitano
item.description: I had a lunch of “Dill-icious” pork dumplings and garlic cucumber salad with a homemade lemon iced tea at Shandong Mama Mini. I walked down to the National Gallery of Victoria (NGV) International to see the KAWS exhibit, along with a few other things in the permanent collection, before heading to the NGV Ian Potter museum focused on Australian art. After the walking & the sight-seeing, I treated myself to some cocktails at Eau de Vie in the Central Business District and Black Pearl in Fitzroy.

item.title: Lune Croissanteri, Brunswick Street Alimentari, Groceries, & Street art
item.description: I went to Lune Croissanteri for some pastries and coffee this morning, Brunswick Street Alimentari for lunch, and Rock Salt & Vinegar for dinner, before seeing some owl street art on my way home. I also survived my first trip to the grocery store today! Lemon Curd Cruffin from Lune Croissanterie Ham and Gruyere Croissant from Lune Croissanterie The bakers at Lune Croissanterie Porchetta panini from Brunswick Street Alimentari

item.title: Sevens Seeds and Hosier Lane
item.description: I walked down to Carlton and had a delicious open lamb sandwich at Seven Seeds, before continuing my walk to Hosier Lane to see my dope street art. I also met up with Taylor & Maki for dinner! Lamb sandwich at Seven Seeds Mark Zuckerberg is watching you Some shots from Hosier Lane Audrey

item.title: Breakfast at Industry Beans
item.description: My first morning in Melbourne! I walked across the street to Industry Beans, where I had a wonderful breakfast in a beautiful sun-drenched restaurant. Flat white Smoked Manchego Omelette: “Chilli roasted zucchini, pickled sweet fennel, paprika roasted pumpkin seeds and pumpkin sourdough” The interior at Industry Beans
